remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类作为公开根的属性类。This class is exposed as the property of the root class. 序列化保存图表的状态，并可将序列化的数据加载到图表的选项。Serialization saves the state of the chart and also provides the option to load the serialized data into the chart. 可以保留所有图表属性，包括图表的数据。All chart properties can be persisted, including the chart's data. 此外，还可以重置所有标记为要序列化的图表属性。In addition, all chart properties marked for serialization can be reset. 管理用户定义的视图状态时，可以根据需要使用此类。This class can optionally be used when managing user-defined view state. 其中一个其`Load`方法可用于加载视图状态，以及之一`Save`时设置的视图状态，可以使用方法。One of its `Load` methods can be used to load the view state, and one of the `Save` methods can be used when setting the view state. 存储序列化数据，可以使用 XML 或二进制格式。The XML or binary formats can be used to store serialized data. 默认情况下，使用 XML，但你可以使用格式属性。XML is used by default, but you can change the format with the property. 图表属性保存和使用加载`Save`和`Load`方法，分别。Chart properties are saved and loaded using the `Save` and `Load` methods, respectively. 请注意，将保存仅包含非默认值的属性。Note that only properties with non-default values will be saved. 数据可以保存和/或使用一个文件，加载流式传输， ，和对象。Data can be saved and/or loaded using a file, stream, , , and objects. 当保存和/或加载数据使用的对象派生自， ，或类，数据的格式必须为 XML。When saving and/or loading data using an object derived from the , , or classes, the format of the data must be XML. 以下列表介绍三种方法，从基本到高级，用于定义可序列化数据。The following list describes three techniques, from basic to advanced, used to define serializable data. 请注意，它也可以定义非可序列化数据。Note that it is also possible to define non-serializable data. 下一段落中介绍了此技术。This technique is described in the next paragraph. - 序列化使用`Save`和`Load`方法，而无需指定任何可序列化的属性。Serialize the using the `Save` and `Load` methods, without specifying any serializable properties. 将序列化的非默认值，其中包括图表的数据，所有图表属性。All chart properties with non-default values, which includes chart data, will be serialized. - 序列化指定的图表属性属性。Serialize the chart properties specified by the property. 属性进行分组的图表属性序列化为类别，如数据、 外观，等等。The property groups the chart properties to be serialized into categories such as Data, Appearance, and so forth. 请注意的名称和对象将自动序列化; 序列化的数据然后应用到现有图表区域和系列加载时。Note that the names of and objects are automatically serialized; the serialized data is then applied to existing chart areas and series when loaded. > [!IMPORTANT] > 在内部实现属性控制作为属性The property is implemented internally by the control as the property - 指定的图表属性的序列化属性。Serialization of chart properties specified by the property. 这是可序列化的所有图表属性的逗号分隔列表。This is a comma-separated listing of all chart properties that are serializable. 此属性设置为一个显式值之后，它负责的开发人员可以指定要保存的所有属性。After this property is set to an explicit value, it is the responsibility of the developer to specify all properties to be saved. 换而言之，与不同属性中，图表区和系列的名称将不会自动持久化。In other words, unlike the property, the names of chart areas and series will not be automatically persisted. 和属性还可以结合使用。The and properties can also be used in conjunction. 但是，请确保时设置，否则指定的图表属性与自身连接属性将被重写。However, make sure that is concatenated with itself when being set, otherwise the chart properties specified by the property will be overridden. 若要禁止某些属性被序列化，请使用属性。To prohibit certain properties from being serialized, use the property. 如果一个属性设置为可序列化和非序列化时使用了通配符，即常见属性具有的优先级。When one property is set as serializable and non-serializable, which is common when wildcards are used, the property has precedence. 但是，优先级也取决于已指定某一属性时使用了多少通配符。However, precedence also depends on how many wildcards were used when a property was specified. 默认情况下，可序列化属性将重置为其默认值之前进行加载。By default, serializable properties are reset to their defaults before they are loaded. 可以使用更改此行为属性。This behavior can be changed using the property. 方法还可用于显式将图表属性重置为其默认值。The method can also be used to explicitly reset chart properties to their default values.

that is, you must specify "Series.Name" and "ChartArea.Name" expressions. 请参阅下面的示例代码将此过程的示例。See the sample code below for an example of this procedure. 同样，如果要使用多个图表区，属性的所有绘制也必须保存。Similarly, if multiple chart areas are being used, the property of all plotted must also be saved. 有时，一个属性可以设置同时序列化和不序列化，这在使用了通配符时很常见。Sometimes, a property can be set to be both serialized and not serialized, which is common when wildcards are used. 表达式具有较低优先级相比表达式。The expression has a lower priority when compared to the expression. 但请注意，使用通配符的字符串表达式对给定权重较低。However, note that less weight is given to string expressions that use wildcards. 例如，如果属性设置为"\*。背景色"和属性设置为，所有 B`ackColor`除属性将序列化对象。For example, if the property is set to "\*.BackColor" and the property is set to , all B`ackColor` properties except for objects will be serialized. 如果您设置属性，属性将在内部设置。If you set the property, the property will be set internally. 如果属性已设置，但另一个属性应序列化，请确保要串联属性时指定该额外属性。If the property is already set but another property needs to be serialized, make sure to concatenate the property when specifying that extra property. 请参阅下面的示例代码将此过程的示例。See the sample code below for an example of this procedure. 此属性将影响所有保存、 加载和重置操作。This property affects all save, load and reset operations.
